incidents.name: Super SIM Network Connectivity Issues

incident_updates.body: The issue related to Super SIM failures has been resolved and is operating normally at this time.

affected_components.name: INTERNET OF THINGS - Super SIM

incident_updates.body: Between ~10:20 UTC and 14:20 UTC, connectivity on one of Super SIM's downstream connectivity partners was impacted. We observed ~26% decline in the number of devices connecting via the IMSI corresponding to those impacted partner. During this period, we observed an increase in the number of connections on other Super SIM IMSIs indicating that many devices reconnecting after the Super SIMs failed over to the other IMSIs on the SIM, reducing the overall impact. If you still have devices offline, try resetting the SIM's connectivity from the Twilio Console or restarting your device. We will provide an update in 2 hours, or as more information becomes available.

affected_components.name: INTERNET OF THINGS - Super SIM

incident_updates.body: We continue experiencing Super SIM connectivity issues. Our engineering team is actively working with the affected network provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner once more information becomes available.

affected_components.name: INTERNET OF THINGS - Super SIM

incident_updates.body: Since 10:20AM UTC we are experiencing Super SIM connectivity issues. Our engineering team is actively working with the affected network provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner once more information becomes available.

incident_updates.body: Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Super SIM. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Connectivity Lost on 8% of Super SIM Devices

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved with regard to Super SIM on one of the sponsors being dropped.

affected_components.name: INTERNET OF THINGS - Super SIM

incident_updates.body: Beginning at 8:32 UTC, we observed 8% of active data sessions on Super SIM on one of the sponsors being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. Our engineering team is actively working on identifying and resolving the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner once more information becomes available.

incidents.name: In Progress Voice API Update Requests to a Subset of Calls Failed

incident_updates.body: Twilio Voice REST API was degraded for 9 minutes between 08:19 am and 08:28 AM Pacific Time on 07/30/2024. During this period of time customers may have experienced 500 error responses on API requests to update in-progress voice calls. The issue has now been resolved.

affected_components.name: DEVELOPER TOOLS - REST API

incident_updates.body: Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue Voice API updates. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

affected_components.name: DEVELOPER TOOLS - REST API

incidents.name: On Call Engineers are Investigating an issue - Customers Unable to Edit/Create Email Template

incident_updates.body: it was determined that there is no noticeable customer impact. All systems are operational.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue where Customers Unable to Edit/Create Email Template. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Sender-id-service db down

incident_updates.body: Twilio's sender ID service was degraded for 1 minute between 20:35:26 - 20:36:28 Pacific Time on 07/28/2024. During this period of time, retrieving sender-id configurations temporarily failed during message delivery. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Programmable Voice Experiencing One-Way Audio Issue

incident_updates.body: We are pleased to inform that the issue with Programmable Voice one-way audio in the AU region has been fully resolved. Our monitoring indicates that the service has returned to normal operation, and we have observed a full recovery.

affected_components.name: PROGRAMMABLE VOICE - Conference

incident_updates.body: We have started seeing recovery for Programmable Voice one way audio in AU region. We will continue to monitor to ensure a full recovery. We expect to provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.
